metadata.name: Mstsc.EXE Execution With Local RDP File
metadata.comment: Detects potential RDP connection via Mstsc using a local ".rdp" file

batch.sql: SELECT * FROM process_activity WHERE time BETWEEN CURRENT_TIMESTAMP() - INTERVAL 24 HOUR AND CURRENT_TIMESTAMP() AND (activity_id = 1 AND endswith(lower(process.name), lower('\\\\mstsc.exe')) AND lower(process.file.name) = lower('mstsc.exe') AND (endswith(lower(process.cmd_line), lower('.rdp')) OR endswith(lower(process.cmd_line), lower('.rdp"'))) AND NOT (lower(process.parent_process.name) = lower('c:\\\\windows\\\\system32\\\\lxss\\\\wslhost.exe') AND contains(lower(process.cmd_line), lower('c:\\\\programdata\\\\microsoft\\\\wsl\\\\wslg.rdp'))))

output.summary: Detects potential RDP connection via Mstsc using a local ".rdp" file

metadata.objective: False positive: Likely with legitimate usage of ".rdp" files References: https://www.blackhillsinfosec.com/rogue-rdp-revisiting-initial-access-methods/, https://web.archive.org/web/20230726144748/https://blog.thickmints.dev/mintsights/detecting-rogue-rdp/
